Jose Mourinho's personal tribute to sacked Leicester City manager Claudio Ranieri By Jon_Paul | Posted: February 24, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Claudio Ranieri and Jose Mourinho Jose Mourinho's personal tribute to sacked Leicester City manager Claudio Ranier... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Jose Mourinho has shown his support for sacked Leicester City manager Claudio Ranieri with his own personal tribute to the Italian. 
Manchester United boss Mourinho wore a shirt bearing Ranieri's initials 'CR' during today's press conference ahead of Sunday's League Cup final against Southampton. 
Mourinho suffered a similar fate to Ranieri, being sacked as Chelsea manager just seven months after leading them to the Premier League title. 
Read more: Brexit, Trump and now Ranieri - a strange decision says Klopp 
The Portuguese has been quick to show solidarity with Ranieri, also sending out a personal messag e on social media earlier in the day. 
"The initials in my shirt, with his name, is my little homage to somebody that wrote the most beautiful history of the Premier League, somebody that would deserve the Leicester stadium to be named 'Claudio Ranieri' and has been sacked," said Mourinho. 
"I thought last season when I was sacked as a champion was a giant negative thing. 
"Now I realise that was peanuts compared with what happened to Claudio. 
"My Instagram was a little homage, my shirt is another one. I don't think he needs more homages because nobody can delete what he did. 
"If some of the stories I am reading are true, or have just a little bit of truth, it's difficult to find words to justify that, but it's also something we managers have to be ready to cope with."
